content.text: Hello, my name is Vladimir. I’m fifteen years old and I live in Russia. I get up at half past six every day. I brush my teeth and I have breakfast at seven o’clock. I go to school on foot at half past seven. I go with friends to the park after school. I go back home at quarter past three. I have dinner and I do my homework. I take a shower at nine o’clock and I go to bed at ten fifteen.

content.text: Hi, my name is Laura. I’m sixteen years old and I live in England. I get up at seven o’clock every morning. I take a shower, then I brush my teeth and I have breakfast at seven thirteen. I go to school by bus at quarter to eight. I go back home at a quarter past six, I do my homework, then I take dinner. I read a book before bed and then I fall asleep at about ten p.m.

content.text: Good morning, my name is Harriet and I'm seventeen years old. I live in New Zealand. I usually wake up at 9:00 a.m. I make myself breakfast and decide what I want to do that day. Usually, I drive into town and meet my friends and then we drive to the beach and go for a walk for a few hours. After that, we would drive to a cafe and have lunch. Then, I spend time with my mother. Usually I spend some time in my room, maybe doing university work or listening to music. Then, as a family, we usually watch some TV. Most days we eat at home, mom cooks dinner.
content.name: X3Or

content.text: Buongiorno, my name is Anais and I am from France. I’m sixteen years old. I live in Paris. I usually wake up early around 6.30, if I have school. First thing after I wake up, I check my Instagram and my emails. Then, I make my breakfast, often smoothies or fruits and tea, sometimes French baguette with butter, so delicious! I usually run for 45 minutes in the morning. During the weekends, we often invite friends for lunch or dinner or barbecue at home, and have a really good time together. Some other things I do during the weekends are going to a museum or a library. We love culture! I can spend 5 hours in a museum, which I know is way too long.
